Package com.rapidminer.belt.column

Class Columns

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.column.Columns
  • public final class Columns
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility functions for columns.
    Author:
    Gisa Meier

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Columns.CleanupOption
      The possible cleanup options for removeUnusedDictionaryValues(Column, CleanupOption, Context)
      static class  Columns.IllegalReplacementException
      Exception thrown when a replacement in a dictionary is not possible since otherwise the same value would be at two indices.
      static class  Columns.InternalColumns
      Column methods for internal access.

    • Method Detail

      • isBicategorical

        public static boolean isBicategorical​(Column column)
        Checks if the column is categorical with exactly two non-null values.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to check
        Returns:
        true if the column is categorical with exactly two values different from null

      • isAtMostBicategorical

        public static boolean isAtMostBicategorical​(Column column)
        Checks if the column is categorical with at most two non-null values.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to check
        Returns:
        true if the column is categorical with at most two values different from null

      • isBicategoricalAndBoolean

        public static boolean isBicategoricalAndBoolean​(Column column)
        Checks if the column is categorical and boolean with exactly two non-null values, one positive and one negative.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to check
        Returns:
        true if the column is categorical has exactly two values with different boolean values associated

      • toBoolean

        public static Column toBoolean​(Column column,
                               java.lang.String positiveValue)
        Sets the positive value for the categorical column if the dictionary has at most two values (including the positive value). If the positive value is not part of the dictionary yet, it is added to the dictionary. The other value, if it exists, will be made negative. In case of a dictionary with only one value the positive value can be null, making the only value negative.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to adjust
        positiveValue - the positive value to use, can be null in case of a dictionary of size 1
        Returns:
        a new categorical column with a boolean dictionary with the given positive value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not categorical or its dictionary has more than two values (including the given positive value)

      • changeDictionary

        public static Column changeDictionary​(Column from,
                                      Column to)
        Creates a column that replaces the from-column's dictionary with the one of the to-column. The categorical indices are updated to match the replacement dictionary (the dictionary itself remains unchanged). Values not contained in the replacement dictionary are declared missing. If the to-column's dictionary is boolean, this is not changed. Therefore, it might happen that the positive value does not appear in the data.
        Parameters:
        from - the column for which to change the dictionary
        to - the column with the dictionary to change to
        Returns:
        a new column with the dictionary of the to-column and the data of the from-column
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the columns have different element types or are not both categorical
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameter is null

      • mergeDictionary

        public static Column mergeDictionary​(Column from,
                                     Column to)
        Merges the dictionary of the from-column with the one of the to-column. A new column is created which has the data of the from-column and a dictionary that starts with the dictionary of the to-column. If a value of the from-column is not part of the dictionary of the to-column it is added to end of the new dictionary. If the to-column's dictionary is boolean, has a positive and the merged dictionary size is not bigger than 2, then the merged dictionary will be boolean with the same positive index.
        Parameters:
        from - the column for which to change the dictionary
        to - the column with the dictionary to start with
        Returns:
        a new column with a dictionary starting with the dictionary of the to-column and the data of the from-column
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the columns have different element types or are not both categorical
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameter is null

      • removeUnusedDictionaryValues

        public static Column removeUnusedDictionaryValues​(Column column,
                                                  Columns.CleanupOption option,
                                                  Context context)
        Removes unused dictionary values from categorical column following the cleanup option. The input column is returned if the input column is not categorical or every dictionary value is used.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to cleanup
        option - the Columns.CleanupOption
        context - the context to use
        Returns:
        the cleaned up column or the input column if no cleanup possible
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the inputs is null

      • compactDictionary

        public static Column compactDictionary​(Column column)
        Creates a new column with a dictionary that contains the same object values as the input but with continuous category indices. For the dictionary of the resulting column, the method Dictionary.get(int) never returns null for an input between 1 and Dictionary.maximalIndex().
        Parameters:
        column - the column with the dictionary to compact
        Returns:
        a new column with a compacted dictionary
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the column is null

      • replaceSingleInDictionary

        public static Column replaceSingleInDictionary​(Column column,
                                               java.lang.String oldValue,
                                               java.lang.String newValue)
        Creates a new column with the oldValue replaced by the newValue in the dictionary. In case this is not possible because the new value is already part of the dictionary, a Columns.IllegalReplacementException is thrown. In that case, the column data needs to be changed, either via a buffer (Buffers.nominalBuffer(Column)) or an apply function (Transformer.applyObjectToNominal(Class, Function, Context). If the old value is not part of the dictionary, nothing is changed.

        In case multiple values need to be replaced, use replaceInDictionary(Column, Map) instead.

        Parameters:
        column - the categorical column in which to replace dictionary values
        oldValue - the value to replace
        newValue - the replacement value
        Returns:
        a new column with the same category indices but changed dictionary or the column if the old value is not present in the dictionary
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the parameters is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not categorical or the old or new value not compatible with the type of the column
        Columns.IllegalReplacementException - if a replacement in the dictionary is not possible because the dictionary already contains the new value

      • replaceInDictionary

        public static Column replaceInDictionary​(Column column,
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> oldToNewValue)
        Creates a new column with the values in the dictionary replaced as specified by the map. In case this is not possible because a new value is already part of the dictionary, a Columns.IllegalReplacementException is thrown. In that case, the column data needs to be changed, either via a buffer (Buffers.nominalBuffer(Column)) or an apply function (Transformer.applyObjectToNominal(Class, Function, Context). If the old value is not part of the dictionary, the mapping is ignored.

        In case only one value should be replaced use replaceSingleInDictionary(Column, String, String) instead.

        Parameters:
        column - the categorical column in which to replace dictionary values
        oldToNewValue - a map from old to new value, the map order does not matter
        Returns:
        a new column with the same category indices but the dictionary changed according to the map
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the parameters is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column is not categorical or the given type is not compatible with the element type of the column
        Columns.IllegalReplacementException - if a replacement in the dictionary is not possible because the dictionary already contains the new value
